question: Which of the following is a technique based on behavior sciences methods?
exp: Management by objective is one of the technique using behavioral science as basis. Other methods based on behavioral sciences. PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT COMMUNICATION INFORMATION SYSTEMS

question: Under extended sickness benefit of ESI act, Tuberculosis benefit is given for duration of:
exp: A person diagnosed with tuberculosis is entitled to extended sickness benefit for 2 years along with 80% wages. This benefit is given to the insured person that has been in continuous employment for 2 years. The Employees State Insurance Act, 1948 Ministry- Union ministry of Labour Chair person- Union minister of Labour Contribution- Employer - 3. 25% of wages Employee - 0. 75% of wages For people with income < 21, 000 per month

question: Mission Indradhanush is for:
exp: Mission Indradhanush-for 7 Preventable diseases Tb Polio Diptheria Peusis Tetanus Hepatitis b Measles + Rota, MR, IPV, JE

question: Nosocomial infections are diagnosed after how many hours of hospitalization / admission?
exp: Nosocomial infections Defined as those infections occurring within 48 hours of hospital admission, 3 days of discharge or 30 days of an operation. Gram-positive bacteria are the commonest cause of nosocomial infections with. Staphylococcus aureusbeing the predominant pathogen. Hospital-acquired pneumonia-Defined as pneumonia that occurs 48 hours or more after admission and did not appear to be incubating at the time of admission. Ventilator-associated pneumonia-Defined as pneumonia that develops more than 48 to 72 hours after endotracheal intubation.

question: Recent influenza pandemic was due to which strain?
exp: Influenza us cause by Ohomyxovirus 3 types: A, B, C - Type A: MC cause of outbreaks/ epidemics; only cause of pandemics Examples: H1 N1 (Type A) - Cause of Swine flu -Recent influenza pandemic H2 N2 (Type A) H5 N1 (Type A) -Cause of An influenza (Bird flu)

question: A study was undeaken to find the relation between COPD and smoking. Patient's data was collected through records from government hospital and record of cigarettes sale from finance and taxation depaments. Study design?
exp: Ecological Study also called Correlation Study Units of study: Population, Data can be used from populations with different characteristics Ecological Study Done at a point of time Done based on Secondary Data i. e. Collected data from records of hospital Data is not collected by Investigator himself. Used in Nutritional Surveys Cannot calculate strength of association / prevalence Unit of Study is population and results are extrapolated projected not on Individuals but on total population. This drawback is known as "Ecological Fallacy"

question: Type - A Bioterrorism agent include:
exp: Bacillus antracis is the most commonly used Type A bio terrorism agent. Cl. Perfringens and brucellosis - Type B bio-terrorism agent Nipah virus - Type C bio-terrorism agent Type A Type B Type C Can be easily disseminated High moality rates (MOST DANGEROUS) Public panic and disruption Can moderately disseminate Moderate morbidity + low morbidity (LESS DANGEROUS) Require enhanced diagnostic capacity Require enhanced surveillance Emerging pathogens Ease to production High morbidity and moality Anthrax(M/C used) Small Pox(Most dangerous) Plague Botulism(Most lethal toxin) Tularaemia VHFs like Ebola and Marburg virus Brucellosis Glanders Melioidosis Psittacosis Q fever Epidemic Typhus Cl. Perfringens Food safety threats Water safety threats Ricin toxin Staphylococcal toxin Hanta virus Nipah virus

question: Vaccine protocol followed after Disaster?
exp: During post disaster phase, All vaccines are contraindicated especially typhoid, cholera and tetanus toxoid. (except measles) Whereas post disaster, typhoid, cholera and tetanus toxoid are mandatory in health workers.
opd: Only the health worker given cholera, typhoid, tetanus toxoid

question: Which of the following cannot be used as Post-coital contraceptive?
exp: 87 Danazol is not an emergency contraceptive. Post coital contraceptive/ emergency contraceptive- Used after intercourse Combined OCPs - used within 72 hours Progesterone only pills - used within 72 hours IUD - used within 5 days RU 486( mifepristone) - used within 72 hours High dose estrogen - used within 5 days

question: "MONICA Project" is associated with:
exp: To look out for the reasons behind the changing trends of Cardiovascular disease worldwide, WHO staed project named MONICA ( Monitoring of trends and determinants in Cardiovasculardisease). Population centres need to be large and numerous; to reliably establish 10-year trends in event rates. Foy-one MONICA Collaborating Centres, using a standardized protocol, are studying 118 Repoing Units (subpopulations) with a total population aged 25-64 (both sexes) of about 15 million.
opa: Risk factor intervention trials for CVD
opc: Monitoring of trends and determinants in cardiovascular disease

question: Prospective screening is done in:
exp: Immigrant screening is an example of prospective screening. Screening of Immigrants from infectious diseases such as Tuberculosis and Syphilis to protect the home population is done. It is done for the benefit of others. Neonatal screening is an example of Prescriptive screening Pap smear is an example of secondary level of prevention.

question: A 32 years old patient develops vomiting 3-4 hours after eating a meal. What is the most likely cause?
exp: Incubation period of staphylococcal food poisoning is 1-6 hours. Food Poisoning Organism Incubation period Staphylococcal 1-6 hours Salmonella 12-24 hours Botulism 12-36 hours Clostridium perfringens 6-24 hours Bacillus cereus 1-6 hours E. coli 8-72 hours

question: Active disinfectant propey of bleaching powder is mainly due to formation of:
exp: The main action of disinfection due to chlorine is due to Hypochlorus acid (90% disinfection). Hypochlorite ions contributes 10% to disinfection. 2. 5 gms of bleaching powder is required for disinfection of 1000 L of water. Bleaching powder or chlorinated lime (Ca. OCl2 ) is a white amorphous powder with a pungent smell of chlorine. When freshly made, it contains about 33 per cent of "available chlorine". It is, however, an unstable compound. On exposure to air, light and moisture, it rapidly loses its chlorine content. The chlorine content of bleaching powder stocks should be frequently checked.

question: Blood bag is discarded in:
exp: Blood bag along with laboratory cultures, specimens of micro-organisms and live and attenuated vaccine are dicarded in YELLOW bag. Blood bags are Pre-treated to sterilize with non-chlorinated chemicals on-site as per National AIDS Control Organisation or World Health Organisation guidelines Microbiology, biotechnology and other clinical laboratory waste: Blood bags. Laboratory cultures, stocks or specimens of micro-organisms, live or attenuated vaccines. Cat. question: Maximum working hours duration including oveime for a person working in a factory, as per The factory act' 1948 is:
exp: As per the Factory act 1948, The total number of hours including oveime should not exceed 60 hours/week. 9 hours/day and 48 hours/week are prescribed under The Factories Act, 1948. The Factories Act, 1948 The Act prohibits employment of children below the age of 14 years 15 and 18 years are declared to be adolescents abd. allowed to work only between 6 A. M. & 7 PM.

question: A child was fed on staple diet of maize for a long time. Which of the following vitamin may get deficient in his body?
exp: In maize eating people, Niacin deficiency is seen leading to pellagra. Maize is a deficient in tryptophan and lysine. Tryptophan is required for the synthesis of Niacin (B3). 60 mg of tryptophan produces 1mg of niacin. Pellagra-The main 3 Ds of pellagra include- Diarrhoea Dermatitis Dementia

question: Indicator of air pollution are:
exp: The best indicators of air pollution aresulphur dioxide, smoke and suspended paicles. These are monitored on a daily basis over several sites, results often collected by a central agency. Air pollution indicators are- CO2, CO SO2, NO2 Air pollution index Soiling index Coefficient of haze Suspended paiculate matter
opc: Sulphur dioxide, hydrogen sulphide, carbon monoxide

question: Liquid chemical waste is discarded in:
exp: Liquid chemical waste used for disinfection purposes, cleaning and housekeeping are discarded in yellow bag. Chemical treatment is done followed by draining the liquid. Category Type of waste Yellow Human Anatomical Waste Animal Anatomical Waste Soiled Waste Expired or Discarded Medicines Chemical Waste Discarded Linens, mattresses, beddings contaminated with blood or body fluid, routine mask and gown g) Micro, Bio-t and other clinical lab waste h) Chemical liquid Waste Red Contaminated Waste (Recyclable) White (Translucent) Waste sharps including Metals Blue Glassware and Metallic Body Implants
